alert.note: Alert for Houston (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 11 at 8:11PM CDT until August 11 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN HOUSTON...SOUTHEASTERN LA CROSSE...SOUTHEASTERN JACKSON...NORTHWESTERN VERNON AND MONROE COUNTIES... At 809 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles south of Black River Falls to near Brownsville, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Automated observation stations. A 60 mph wind gust was measured at the La Crosse airport. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Sparta and Fort Mc Coy around 815 PM CDT. Cashton and Millston around 820 PM CDT. Tomah and Westby around 835 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include County Roads G And H, Brinkman Ridge, Jersey Valley County Park, Shamrock, Irish Hill, North Side Of La Crosse and South Side Of La Crosse. This includes the following highways... Interstate 94 between mile markers 117 and 145. Interstate 90 in Wisconsin between mile markers 8 and 9, and between mile markers 12 and 43. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
